alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued March 11 at 3:19PM EST until March 12 at 5:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk County. * WHEN...Late tonight. * IMPACTS..Brief minor flooding of the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.7 FT, MODERATE 6.4 FT, MAJOR 7.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.3 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 12/04 AM 5.5/ 6.0 2.1/ 2.6 2.1/ 2.6 1 MINOR 12/04 PM 4.4/ 4.9 1.0/ 1.5 1.8/ 2.2 0 NONE 13/05 AM 5.0/ 5.5 1.6/ 2.0 1.7/ 2.2 0-1 NONE 13/05 PM 4.2/ 4.7 0.9/ 1.4 1.8/ 2.2 1-2 NONE ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.8 FT, MODERATE 5.8 FT, MAJOR 6.8 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.8 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 12/01 AM 4.6/ 5.1 1.6/ 2.0 1.8/ 2.2 1 MINOR 12/02 PM 3.6/ 4.1 0.6/ 1.1 1.5/ 2.0 0 NONE 13/02 AM 4.0/ 4.5 1.1/ 1.6 1.4/ 1.9 0 NONE 13/03 PM 3.2/ 3.7 0.2/ 0.8 1.3/ 1.8 1 NONE 14/03 AM 4.7/ 5.2 1.8/ 2.2 2.1/ 2.6 1 MINOR FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.3 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 12/03 AM 9.0/ 9.5 1.7/ 2.2 2.0/ 2.5 1 MINOR 12/04 PM 8.1/ 8.6 0.8/ 1.3 1.8/ 2.2 1 NONE 13/04 AM 8.7/ 9.2 1.4/ 1.9 1.8/ 2.2 1 NONE 13/04 PM 8.0/ 8.5 0.7/ 1.1 1.9/ 2.3 1-2 NONE &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
